byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Hong Kong, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: India's Prime Min Narendra Modi arrives in China to hold talks with Chinese Pres Xi Jinping on border disputes and trade deficit.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India and President Xi Jinping of China sought to highlight the ancient ties between the two neighbors by visiting historical sites.

headline.main: Narendra Modi Starts Trip to China With a Burst of Sightseeing
headline.print_headline: While Stressing Ancient Ties, Modi Presses China on Borders and Trade

snippet: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India and President Xi Jinping of China sought to highlight the ancient ties between the two neighbors by visiting historical sites.
